other_tests.findings: A significant discrepancy in blood pressure was observed between the upper and lower extremities: upper extremities registered 150/100 mmHg, and lower extremities registered 90/65 mmHg.
The pulses in the lower extremities at the popliteal arteries and dorsalis pedis were feeble compared to the pulses in the bilateral radial arteries.

CT-A revealed large collateral vessels all over the chest wall with tortuously dilated internal mammary arteries, posterior and anterior intercostal arteries, and large paravertebral and parascapular collateral vessels. Sagittal images showed a complete discontinuity between the aortic arch and descending thoracic aorta, with a 1.5 cm gap.
